details.description: A large tree has been cut down and supported only by a rope.
details.disable: The trap cannot be disabled in advance (unless the PCs are able to out stealth Vengeant Thorn and sneak up on him before the wagon reaches the target zone.)

source.value: Pathfinder Society Scenario 1-04: Bandits of Immenwood

description.value:
Trigger The squirrel swam finishes chewing through the rope at the beginning of its turn

Effect The tree drops 10 feet in front of the wagon, blocking the road. The tree deals [[/r {3d12}[bludgeoning]]]{3d12 bludgeoning damage} to anyone beneath the tree when it drops and pushes them out of its space in a random direction. A creature that succeeds at a @Check[type:reflex|dc:20|traits:damaging-effect,hazard,mechanical,trap] save takes no damage and rolls out of the way in a random direction. On a critical success, it can choose the direction. Mounted creatures do not attempt a save unless their mount attempts a save and fails. If a mounted creature's mount fails the save, the mounted creature can attempt its own @Check[type:reflex|dc:18|name:Mounted Deadfall|traits:damaging-effect,hazard,mechanical,trap] save by leaping off its mount, taking [[/r {1d4}[bludgeoning]]]{1d4 bludgeoning damage} from the fall. This damage is taken whether the save is successful or not.
